business.headline: SIP vs RD: Where should your monthly savings go?Would you rather sleep peacefully or grow wealthy quietly? That's essentially what the SIP vs RD debate boils down to. Both allow disciplined monthly investing, but one protects capital while the other builds it. So which one deserves your money?

Man flags extra charge on cash-on-delivery payments, Centre launches probeThe Department of Consumer Affairs has launched an investigation into e-commerce sites charging additional fees on cash-on-delivery payments.

Agents' body questions GST cut, says move undermines insurance distributionPrashant Mhatre, All India President of the General Insurance Agents Federation Integrated (GIAFI), has sounded an alarm, saying the decision risks weakening the role of agents, brokers, and advisors who are central to India's insurance reach.
Planning a personal loan? Don't make these 5 errorsWhile personal loans can be a handy financial tool, they come with risks if mismanaged. Avoid these five common errors to keep your finances safe.

Wintrack vs Chennai Customs is a sorry tale of grease of doing business in IndiaChennai-based logistics company Wintrack has ceased Indian operations, alleging repeated bribery demands and harassment by Chennai Customs, exposing the ugly truth that at Indian Customs integrity is the real contraband.

Delhi government may revise circle rates, public feedback invitedThe Delhi government is considering a revision of circle rates across the city and has called on the public to share their views before any changes are finalised.

Health insurance in 2025: Key traps that could drain your pocketClauses such as room rent caps, deductibles, and co-pay options are often buried deep in policy documents but can have a massive influence on the claim process.
Sensex, Nifty recover losses to end higher fuelled by gains in metal stocksThe S&P BSE Sensex added 223.86 points to close at 81,207.17, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 57.95 points to end at 24,894.25.

63% of households aware, yet only 9.5% invest in markets, Sebi survey showsDespite growing awareness about investing in the markets, the latest Sebi survey shows that only a small fraction of households, i.e., just 9.5%, are actively investing.

Looking for high returns? This small savings scheme beats PPF and NSCMany investors assume PPF or NSC offer the best returns, but the scheme leads the pack with the highest interest among small savings schemes. Have a look.

Wintrack vs Chennai Customs: If forced to bribe, can companies fight legally?The Finance Ministry has already ordered an official probe, but the matter has also raised a wider debate: if businesses are forced to pay bribes to get their consignments cleared, do they have the law on their side?

Will Zerodha end its zero-brokerage model for equity delivery trades?Zerodha, long known for offering free equity delivery trades, could soon charge for delivery trades for the first time, signalling a major shift for investors.

entertainment.headline: Kerala government honours Mohanlal after Dadasaheb Phalke win Kerala government honoured veteran actor Mohanlal for receiving the Dadasaheb Phalke Award. The ceremony, held in Thiruvananthapuram, was attended by Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan.

Dhanashree Verma shares cryptic post after Samay Raina, Yuzvendra Chahal's banter Stand-up comic Samay Rana's post referencing Yuzvendra Chahal sparked debate online. Soon after his video, Dhanshree Verma shared a cryptic post which is believed to be a dig at Raina.

Bigg Boss 19 ep 42: Salman Khan jokes with Elvish Yadav as he appears on show Internet personality Elvish Yadav appeared on 'Bigg Boss 19' for a Weekend Ka Vaar episode. Salman Khan greeted Elvish with his catchphrase and introduced a task for contestants.

Netflix cap drops around $15 billion after Elon Musk's boycott call Elon Musk's boycott Netflix call sends shares tumbling, sparking a new culture clash. His posts on X came after he cancelled his own subscription to the streaming platform while taking a dig at it.

Taylor Swift's The Life of a Showgirl sparks global orange door hunt Taylor Swift launched an international promotional puzzle for her new album. Orange doors with QR codes have appeared in cities such as London and Berlin.

Hina Khan opens up on taboo around cancer in the entertainment industry Actor Hina Khan discusses the stigma surrounding cancer among artists and advocates for continued work. The actor shares her experience after being diagnosed with stage three breast cancer.

Anshula Kapoor honours late mother with engagement outfit, Maheep performs duties Maheep Kapoor performed mother duties at Anshula Kapoor and Rohan Thakkar's Gor Dhana ceremony. Attended by family members, several pictures from the event have emerged online.

Kantara Chapter 1 box office Day 3: Rishab's film earns Rs 160 crore, beats Sikandar Rishab Shetty's film 'Kantara Chapter 1' surpassed the 150-crore mark in three days. The film has set the cash registers ringing at Rs 162 crore.

Sunny Sanskari box office Day 3: Varun, Janhvi's entertainer eyes Rs 30 crore Varun Dhawan and Janhvi Kapoor's rom-com 'Sunny Sanskari Ki Tulsi Kumari' has earned Rs 22 crore at the box office despite receiving mixed reviews. After dipping on Day 2, the film bounced back on its third day with collections of Rs 7.25 crore.

Anita Hassanandani crowned winner of reality show Chhoriyan Chali Gaon Actor Anita Hassanandani was announced as the winner of the reality show 'Chhoriyan Chali Gaon.' The show highlighted rural life and tested celebrities with traditional tasks.

Of Gods and ghosts: How mythology and folklore power India's cinematic universes Indian filmmakers are increasingly creating cinematic universes inspired by mythology and folklore, blending traditional stories with modern narratives. This trend is reshaping Indian cinema with ambitious projects spanning films, animation, and more.

Baahubali films off Netflix: On which platforms can you watch them in India? Baahubali and Baahubali 2 are currently not available on Netflix. However, fans can catch the epic films on five other platforms. Check it out.

BTS Jin concerts cause Incheon hotel prices to soar by 200 per cent Hotels near Incheon Munhak Main Stadium raise rates sharply ahead of BTS' Jin's encore concerts. Fans and non-fan guests report cancelled bookings and increased accommodation costs.

Arbaaz Khan, Sshura Khan arrive at hospital ahead of baby's birth: Reports Actor Arbaaz Khan and Sshura Khan arrived at PD Hinduja Hospital for the birth of their first child together, according to reports. Family members and friends attended a private baby shower before admission.

Genie, Make A Wish Review: Woo-bin, Suzy's chemistry casts a spell, almost!Release Date:Fri Oct 03, 2025 South Korean actors Kim Woo-bin and Suzy reunite in the new fantasy-romance K-drama 'Genie, Make a Wish'. The series explores temptation and morality with a unique blend of dark humour and fantasy.
Vijay Sethupathi hosts Bigg Boss Tamil Season 9: Read all about the show 'Bigg Boss Tamil' Season 9 will premiere on October 5. Vijay Sethupathi returns as host for the new season.

When is Rashmika Mandanna's The Girlfriend releasing? Check confirmed date here Makers of 'The Girlfriend', starring Rashmika Mandanna, confirmed the film's release date on Saturday, a day after reports of her engagement with Vijay Deverakonda went viral. The film also stars Dheekshith Shetty.

Samay Raina takes hilarious dig at Dhanashree, Yuzvendra in new ad with RJ Mahvish Comedian Samay Raina featured in a new ad with Yuzvendra Chahal's rumoured girlfriend, RJ Mahvish. In the commercial, Raina took a sly dig at Yuzvendra and his ex-wife Dhanashree Verma.

Vijay Deverakonda, Rashmika Mandanna engagement: A look at their timeline Actors Rashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakonda got engaged at a private ceremony in Hyderabad. The couple's relationship timeline has included years of speculation and subtle public hints.

general news.headline: India continue no-handshake policy in group clash vs PakistanHarmanpreet Kaur's India continued their no-handshake policy during the toss ceremony ahead of their ICC Women's World Cup group-stage clash against Pakistan in Colombo on Sunday.

Emergency engine deploys on UK-bound Air India flight, airline says all safeAn Air India Boeing 787-8 from Amritsar to Birmingham was grounded after its emergency Ram Air Turbine (RAT) deployed mid-descent, though the flight landed safely.

IND vs PAK Live: Pakistan opt to bowl, no handshakes at tossIndia (INDW) vs Pakistan (PAKW) LIVE, Women's World Cup: Pakistan win the toss and opt to bowl first in Colombo. The two captains do not shake hands at the toss. Both India and Pakistan have made one change each in their line-up.

9 dead as heavy rain, landslides hit Darjeeling; roads blocked, bridges collapseThe North Bengal region has been under red alert as the weather body predicted extremely heavy rain in the sub-Himalayan districts of Darjeeling, Kalimpong, Cooch Behar, Jalpaiguri, and Alipurduar until Sunday morning.

Why do doctors have horrible handwriting, and can it be cured?Medical prescriptions that are nothing but scribbles and scrawls are very common. Bad handwriting of doctors is a problem faced regularly by patients and pharmacists, and recently saw a stern observation by a high court in a medico-legal case. Here's why doctors have bad handwriting and the way to fix illegible prescriptions.

Dragged by hair, forced to kiss Israel flag: Greta Thunberg 'abused' in detentionTwo activists who took part in a flotilla seeking to deliver aid to Gaza alleged that detainees were denied clean food and water, while their belongings and medicines were seized by Israeli forces.
Bihar will have EVM ballots, candidate photos appear in colour: Poll body chiefBihar to be first state where EVM ballots, candidate photos appear in colour: Poll body chief

Shutdown Blues in Washington, Ripples in New Delhi, MumbaiA prolonged government shutdown coupled with steep tariffs threatens to further sap American demand, unsettle capital flows, and further deepen pressures already weighing on India's exports, rupee and stock markets.

China's 24-hour spas are going viral. Here's why India needs oneIn China, these 24-hour spas are not just about scented candles, soothing music or massages. It's beyond the traditional and is currently the internet's latest obsession.
Learn How Adobe Express Is Making Graphic Design Fun In ClassroomsThe Adobe Express app is available on any smart device or desktop computer.

Air India Dreamliner scare revives AI 171 crash ghostsConsidered the aircraft's last lifeline, the fan-like device drops naturally from the underside of the plane when both engines fail, as was seen seconds before the fated AI 171 crash in June.
The Operation Sindoor 2.0 warningIndia's security establishment warns Field Marshal Asim Munir against adventurism.

Ozempic in India. It's genesis lies in a 1970s experimentIts origin is rooted in decades of careful research and innovative science that transformed a naturally occurring hormone into a powerful medicine.

Woman posts video of Blinkit delivery agent touching her inappropriatelyA woman shared a video of a Blinkit delivery agent touching her inappropriately while delivering a parcel. She posted the clip on X, which has since gone viral.

Doctor arrested after 11 children die in Madhya Pradesh from toxic cough syrupThe police have arrested Dr Praveen Soni, who prescribed the cough syrup to children, and registered a case against him and Sresun Pharmaceuticals, Tamil Nadu-based manufacturer of the 'Coldrif' syrup.

Meet Sanae Takaichi, biker turned 'Iron Lady' set to be Japan's next PMThe 64-year-old leader, driven by a nation-first approach, is even ready to take the US head on if she believes that the ongoing trade deal is harmful or unfair to Japan. Once a drummer in a college heavy metal band, sporting pink hair and racing on two wheels, Takaichi gave up motorcycles when she entered politics.

Tennis rigged for Alcaraz and Sinner? Zverev makes shocking allegationsGermany's Alexander Zverev has accused tennis tournaments of making courts that favour Jannik Sinner and Carlos Alcaraz. Zverev's allegations come only days after Roger Federer spoke about the issue.

Are dropouts becoming the preferred hires over top IIT graduates?Dropping out of elite institutions like IIT is emerging as a new credential in India's startup ecosystem. Frontier tech founders are increasingly valuing curiosity, courage, and self-direction over conventional degrees, rewarding those willing to leave safe paths and forge their own way.

Will the Asia Cup row overshadow the India-Pakistan Colombo blockbuster?Women's World Cup: India's group clash with Pakistan in Colombo goes beyond cricket, unfolding amid political tension and the lingering shadow of recent men's team controversies. While both camps are keen to keep politics out of the contest, India will look to extend their dominant record over their arch-rivals.

Drug watchdog wants action against Coldrif makers under serious offences: ReportThe action has been taken in the wake of suspicion linking the death of 11 children in Madhya Pradesh and Rajasthan with this Coldrif cough syrup.

India's chess stars ft Gukesh, Deshmukh stunned by Team USA in all-new live spectacle The Indian chess team suffered a surprising 0-5 loss to Team USA in the first leg of the Checkmate event. The defeat sets the stage for a dramatic second leg in India where the home team will seek redemption.

Vinicius Jr. double vs Villarreal takes Real Madrid top of LaLiga table Vinicius Jr. scored twice and Kylian Mbappe added another as Real Madrid beat Villarreal 3-1 at Santiago Bernabeu. The win helped Real take over the top spot in the LaLiga table.

Manchester United's players showed they don't want to change coach: Ruben Amorim Manchester United manager Ruben Amorim emphasised that his squad has shown complete support for him after their 2-0 triumph over Sunderland at Old Trafford on Saturday.

From cancer to gold medals: Heinrich Popow's inspiring journey to greatness Heinrich Popow was diagnosed with cancer at a young age, which led to the amputation of his left leg. However, the German didn't let his condition become his weakness and etched his name in history books with his inspiring journey as a para-athlete.

Gambhir's favourite: Srikkanth's dig at player after Australia tour selection Former India cricketer Kris Srikkanth has taken a dig at Harshit Rana after the pacer's selection in the tour of Australia. Srikkanth joked that Rana was Gambhir's favourite.

Wanted to play under MS Dhoni's captaincy: Suryakumar reveals his biggest regret India's T20I skipper Suryakumar Yadav expressed regret at never having played under MS Dhoni, while highlighting the influence of Dhoni, Virat Kohli, and Rohit Sharma on his career following India's Asia Cup triumph.

Lionel Messi helps Inter Miami beat New England Revolution 4-1 Lionel Messi showcased his playmaking brilliance as he set up three goals to lead Inter Miami to a commanding 4-1 victory over the New England Revolution. The win propelled Inter Miami to third place in the Eastern Conference and marked Messi's 41st goal contribution of the MLS regular season.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
